article:
:For other persons with a similar name, see: [[William Wiley (disambiguation)]].
'William Wiley' was a sailor of the United States Navy in the 19th century who
served in the First Barbary War.

Besides a few details of his service in the Navy, little is known of the life of
William Wiley. He entered the Navy on 2 April 1803 and was assigned to the
schooner ''Enterprise'' in the Mediterranean Squadron. After attaining the rates
of boatswain, boatswain's mate, and then a reduction to quartermaster, Wiley
took part in the daring raid led by Lieutenant Stephen Decatur, Jr., in the
ketch ''Intrepid'' at Tripoli harbor on 16 February 1804, destroying the frigate
''Philadelphia'' in the engagement. Quartermaster Wiley was transferred to the
brig ''Scourge'' soon thereafter, and this is where his documentary trail ends.
categories: United States people of the Barbary Wars
